instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.C7125: What is C7125? Capacitor between CHGR_BOOT and CHGR_PHASE important for bootstrapping creation of PPBUS_G3H on 2013-2015 macbook pros.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light when battery plugged in
threads.message: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light when battery plugged in, when battery unplugged board works fine , will not work from the battery only , somehow i have 19v on <RESISTOR>R7006</RESISTOR> even with <DIODE>D7005</DIODE> removed which means somehow the charger voltage is going directly to the battery ??? , i cant see on the schematic where these two voltage lines may short together if <DIODE>D7005</DIODE> is removed

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light when battery plugged in
threads.message:
Change <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR>.
Its high-side part is shorted...

Be sure <CAPACITOR>C7125</CAPACITOR> is good.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light when battery plugged in
